TEI:
&teiHeader; &facsimile;
47 [Clement.]
SEint Clement was Ibo&rrot;e at Rome &punctelev; Ifurn ifurn bi olde dawe
Of þe hexte men he was icome &punctelev; þa þat weren in þulke lawe
his Moder moder hiet Macidiane &punctelev; his fader Fau&slong;tinian
Twei b&rrot;eþren he hadde eldo&rrot;e þane he &punctelev; heo&rrot;e namen ich telle kan
Þat on hiet Fau&slong;t þat oþur Fau&slong;t&ydot;n &punctelev; tw&ydot;nnes boþe hu&ydot; were
Fader and moder weren glade of heom &punctelev; þat heom biȝete and bere
Swiþe fair womman heo&rrot;e Moder moder [added later.] was &punctelev; þe faire&slong;te þat Men men wu&slong;te
hire louerd heo louede treweliche &punctelev; nonoþur of heom men nu&slong;te
Fo&rrot; hire fairhede hire louerdes b&rrot;oþer &punctelev; fondede with al[overlined.] is miȝte
To b&rrot;ingue hire in fole loue &punctelev; bi daiȝe and eke bi n&ydot;ȝte
Þis guode womman was[MS. wa&slong;t] &slong;tudefa&slong;t &punctelev; he nolde nouȝt don is wille
Ake euere Ansuerede him fa&ydot;re inov &punctelev; and bar hire faire and &slong;tille
he ofsouȝte hire so swiþe &punctelev; þat no pais heo nadde
heo nu&slong;t[e] ȝwat was hire be&slong;te red &punctelev; ake so&rrot;e of him heo d&rrot;adde
And þouȝte ȝif heo tolde hire louerd fo&rrot;e &punctelev; þat he wolde beo wroth
And þe mo&rrot;e hatie is b&rrot;oþer &punctelev; þat were hire swiþe loth
heo þouȝte hou heo miȝte on take &punctelev; þat heo ane ȝw&ydot;le nere
Ovt of is siȝte in oþur &slong;tude &punctelev; þat heo furȝite were
heo hire biþouȝte of one quo&ydot;ntise &punctelev; þat to hire louerd heo seide[MS. leide?]
A niȝt In hire bed heo bigan to sike &punctelev; ase þei heo of slepe ab&rrot;e&ydot;de
A sire heo seide merci þin o&rrot;e &punctelev; ich am in grete d&rrot;ede
An hard metingue me hath imat &punctelev; Inot ȝwat me is to rede
Me þouȝte þat on of ovre godes &punctelev; cam here bifo&rrot;e þe
And hiet me greiþi ha&slong;tifueliche &punctelev; mine twei sones and me
And wiende with hem and wonie &punctelev; feo&rrot; In an oþur londe
Fo&rrot;to ich oþur oþur
he&slong;te hadde &punctelev; of him oþur is sonde
And bote ȝif ich sone dude so &punctelev; he swo&rrot; with grete oþe
To luþere deþe he wolde do &punctelev; us and o&rrot;e child&rrot;en boþe
Þarefo&rrot;e sire biþench þe wel &punctelev; ȝwat þarof þov wolt rede
Fo&rrot; bote it beo sone ido &punctelev; fo&rrot;soþe we beoth dede
Þis guode Man man [overlined.] lai in grete care &punctelev; And þene deth so&rrot;e he d&rrot;adde
biþouȝte him &slong;trete In swuche neode &punctelev; þene be&slong;te red he radde
Dame he seide ȝwane it is so &punctelev; to schilden us fram care
Þov schalt nime þine twei sones &punctelev; a[n] to[MS. ato] Atenes fare
Þov schalt habbe with þe men Inowe inowe &punctelev; And treso&rrot; also
Þov schalt ȝwane þou þudere come&slong;t &punctelev; þine sones to lo&rrot;e do
Þat hu&ydot; leo&rrot;nien of clergie &punctelev; and ȝwan o&rrot;e god God þe sent tokningue
Fo&rrot;to comen hom aȝein &punctelev; þov schalt heom with þe b&rrot;ingue
Glad was þo þis guode wijf &punctelev; of þat leoue rede
heo greiþede hire and wende fo&rrot;th &punctelev; ase hire louerd sede
heo gan hire twei sones &punctelev; toward atenes Atenes lede
Ake seint clement Clement athom with is fader &punctelev; bilefde fo&rrot; ȝonghede
Fo&rrot; he was onneþes fif ȝer old &punctelev; and fo&rrot; þat he scholde beo
his fader solas and fo&rrot; he nadde &punctelev; bote child&rrot;ene þreo
Þo þis guode wijf was fo&rrot;th iwent &punctelev; and hire louerdes b&rrot;oþer it wu&slong;te
Þat hire louede in fole loue &punctelev; no red þarof he nu&slong;te
¶Fo&rrot; wrathþe to is b&rrot;oþur he seide &punctelev; sire hov geth þis
Is þi wijf fram þe Iwent iwent &punctelev; heo is &slong;trong ho&rrot;e iwis
heo haueth me wel longue iloued &punctelev; ne[r. no] leng hele ich ne ma&ydot;
And to b&rrot;ingue me in fole dede &punctelev; heo fonde fondede niȝt and da&ydot;
Onneþe ich me miȝte with hire wite &punctelev; fo&rrot; siker inolde it do
Fo&rrot; sunne ne fo&rrot; þe loue of þe &punctelev; ne fo&rrot; mi treovnesse also
Anon so heo it onderȝat &punctelev; þat inolde don hire wille
On of þine h&ydot;nene heo louede &punctelev; In folie wel &slong;tille
Þat hath bi hire wel ofte ileie &punctelev; ake þat þov it ne onderȝete
heo þouȝte hov heo miȝte with him beo &punctelev; fo&rrot; heo nolde him nouȝt lete
Þarefo&rrot;e heo þouȝte ane feolle wrench &punctelev; of wommanes ku&ydot;nde lo&rrot;e
And is igo with hire copiner &punctelev; þov ne sixt hire nonmo&rrot;e
Fo&rrot; ofte men seggez and soth it is &punctelev; þat þis wommen beoth
Feolle and false and þat me fo&rrot;þinchez &punctelev; þat we þe soþe iseoth
So&rrot;i was þis guode Man man &punctelev; þo he heo&rrot;de þis
Þat his wijf þat he louede muche &punctelev; scholde so don amis
Ant þat heo was so fram him iwent &punctelev; and þat heo ne bilefde bihinde
his sones þat him so leoue weren &punctelev; ne he nu&slong;te ȝware heom finde
After he wolde habbe iwent &punctelev; ake he ne do&rrot;&slong;te fo&rrot; care
Of cleme[n]te is ȝongue sone &punctelev; la&slong;te he scholde fo&rrot;fare.[al. 2 vv. mo&rrot;e.]
Fo&rrot;th wende þis wijf with hire sones &punctelev; ase god God hire wolde sende
In scipe heo dude hire in þe se &punctelev; into an oþur londe to wende.
Amidde þe se aȝein ane roche &punctelev; þat schip bigan to glide
Þat it altod&rrot;of and hu&ydot; fullen out &punctelev; euerech in is side
A wawe þare cam of þe se &punctelev; þo&rrot;u o&rrot;e louerdes sonde
And ca&slong;te þis guode wijf al quik &punctelev; anonriȝt to þe londe
Anon so heo was up ica&slong;t &punctelev; and to hire riȝte witte cam
And mi&slong;te hire twei leoue sones &punctelev; gret deol to hire heo nam
Into þe se heo wolde habbe ilope &punctelev; hireseolf fo&rrot;to ad&rrot;enche
Ȝif it nadde ibeo fo&rrot; grete hope &punctelev; of þing þat heo gan þenche
Þat þe se wolde some t&ydot;me &punctelev; hire sones to londe ca&slong;te
Fo&rrot; men seggez heo wole ech ded þing &punctelev; weo&rrot;pen up atþe la&slong;te
hadde heo enes heo&rrot;e bodies iseiȝe &punctelev; hire þouȝte þat heo ne rouȝte
Wide and longue heo ȝeode aboute &punctelev; and heo&rrot;e bodies souȝte
Þo heo ne miȝte heom finde &punctelev; heo ȝal and weop ful so&rrot;e
heo d&rrot;ovȝ of hire tressene and ca&slong;te awei &punctelev; fo&rrot; heo ne hopede to heom nonmo&rrot;e
hire hondene heo wrong and tognovȝ &punctelev; þat flesch riȝt to þe bone
And altognovȝ þe senewes &punctelev; and made ful so&rrot;i mone
heo o&rrot;n ase heo witles were &punctelev; aboute into al þe londe
Wumnen Wimmen hadden of hire gret revþe &punctelev; þat heo tognov so hire honde
And fondeden ȝeo&rrot;ne to confo&rrot;ti hire &punctelev; ake hu&ydot; alle ne miȝten make
Þat heo wolde into hire heo&rrot;te &punctelev; ani gladnesse take
Into a wommanes hous heo cam &punctelev; þat longue was bed&rrot;ede
Þat gret revþe hadde þo heo iheo&rrot;de &punctelev; hire so weope and grede
heo confo&rrot;tede hire ȝwat so heo miȝte &punctelev; and made hire bileue
with hire aldai with glad semblaunt &punctelev; fo&rrot;to it was neiȝ eue
So heo confo&rrot;tede þis guode wijf &punctelev; þat heo bilefte þare at[at superscr.] Inne
Mid[MS. And al. And mid] weo&rrot;ke of hire hondene &punctelev; hire liflode fo&rrot;to winne
With spinningue and with sevw&ydot;ngue &punctelev; þat heo wel couþe do
Þarewith heo fedde hire swiþe wel &punctelev; and hire o&slong;tesse also
Sone þareafter þe senewes &punctelev; of hire hondene bigonne to schrinke
Fo&rrot; heo heom hadde er so fo&rrot;gnawe &punctelev; þat heo ne miȝte nonmo&rrot;e swinke
So þat heo ne miȝte iwelde &punctelev; noþur Arm arm ne honde
to pulte enes mete to hire mouth &punctelev; ase hit was godes Godes sonde
Þat deol þat heo made [þo] &punctelev; no tongue it telle ma&ydot;
Alas heo seide þus longue ileoued &punctelev; and þat ich euere abod þis da&ydot;
Fo&rrot; mo&rrot;e so&rrot;ewe þane me is on &punctelev; neuere womman ne hadde
Þe Io&ydot;e ioye of mi louerd fur&slong;t i fo&rrot;les &punctelev; fo&rrot; sunne þat ich d&rrot;adde
And bilefde clement Clement mi ȝongue &punctelev; þat me was so leof iwis
And sethþe les mine tweie sones in þe se &punctelev; þat weren al mi blis
And al one fram mine freond &punctelev; þus feo&rrot; in onecouþe londe
Mit deol and so&rrot;uwe ich habbe ileoued &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ swunch of mine honde
Novþe mine hondene me beoth binome &punctelev; þat Ine ma&ydot; heom enes wawe
Alas þus longue in care ileoued &punctelev; þat inere ib&rrot;ouȝt of lijfdawe
Þat deol þat heo made &punctelev; revþe it was to telle
Ofte heo was ope þe pointe &punctelev; hiresulf fo&rrot;to aquelle
Fram do&rrot;e to do&rrot;e hire mete heo bad &punctelev; and with þat he miȝte Iwinne iwinne
heo fedde hiresulf and hire ho&slong;tesse &punctelev; ȝwane heo cam to hire Inne.
HIre louerd athom aftur hire &punctelev; oflonget was wel so&rrot;e
And sente men to sechen hire &punctelev; ake hu&ydot; ne comen aȝein nonmo&rrot;e
Oþere he sente into al þat lond &punctelev; and þo hu&ydot; hadden longue isouȝt
hu&ydot; comen aȝein and tolden him &punctelev; þat hu&ydot; ne miȝten hire finde nouȝt
Þo gan he Clement is ȝongue sone &punctelev; Into guode warde take
And wend himsulf into al þat lond &punctelev; fo&rrot;to sechen is make
he ne cam neuereft hom aȝein &punctelev; wel wide he hire souȝte
And ȝeode aboute and bad is mete &punctelev; þat of is lijf he ne rouȝte
¶Twenti ȝer he bad is mete &punctelev; and is wijf ȝeot wel mo
he ful into feblesse of elde &punctelev; þat vnneþe he miȝte go.[al. 2 vv. mo&rrot;e.]
Seint clement Clement þis ȝongue child &punctelev; to clergie was ido
he iwerth sone a gret clerk &punctelev; quo&ydot;nte and guod also
Þo&rrot;uȝ his clergie him þouȝte &punctelev; þat heo&rrot;e lawe nas nauȝt
he wilnede muche to w&ydot;ten of god God &punctelev; ȝif ani man him hadde itauȝt
HIt bifeol þat seint Barnabe &punctelev; Into Rome cam
And clement Clement h&ydot;ne heo&rrot;de a da&ydot; &punctelev; p&rrot;echi of cri&slong;tinedom
So þat of þis holie Apo&slong;tle &punctelev; he lette him cri&slong;tni anon
And bicam þe be&slong;te p&rrot;echur &punctelev; þat miȝte on eo&rrot;þe gon
he heo&rrot;de telle of seint peter Peter &punctelev; þat In in þe londe of Iudee was
Are he to him were Icome &punctelev; glad ne bliþe he nas
he bicam is o desciple &punctelev; and aboute with him wende
Fo&rrot;to p&rrot;echie cri&slong;tinedom &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ wit þat god God him sende
S&ydot;mon Magus þe luþere Man man &punctelev; ȝeode in Ane ane oþur londe
To p&rrot;echi aȝein Cri&slong;tinedom &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ þe deoueles sonde
Tweie desciples he hadde with him &punctelev; þat þo hu&ydot; onderȝete
Þe falshede þat with him was &punctelev; hu&ydot; gonne him sone fo&rrot;lete
To seint peter Peter hu&ydot; wenden anon &punctelev; and his desciples bicome
glad was seint peter Peter of heom &punctelev; and þonkede god God ilome
SEint Clement tolde a da&ydot; &punctelev; to seint peter Peter wel &slong;tille
hov hit of is freond bifeol &punctelev; as it was godes Godes wille
And alhov is Moder moder ȝeode awei &punctelev; with is b&rrot;eþren tweie
Þat he wende þat hu&ydot; ad&rrot;onke weren &punctelev; oþur i&slong;to&rrot;ue bi þe weie
And hov is fader wende to sechen heom &punctelev; þo he ne saiȝ oþur red
And [he][om.] wende þat he were ad&rrot;eint &punctelev; oþur fo&rrot; deole ded
And hov frendles he was op ib&rrot;ouȝt &punctelev; Into into sw&ydot;che lo&rrot;e
Þo seint peter Peter iheo&rrot;de þis &punctelev; he gan to weope so&rrot;e
Ase seint petur Petur ȝeode a dai &punctelev; p&rrot;echinde ouer lond
Ane womman þat him þouȝte gent and freo &punctelev; In grete miseise he fond
Ȝware heo ȝeode and bad hire mete &punctelev; he Axede axede hire anon
Ȝw&ydot; heo ne miȝte hire mete Iwinne &punctelev; and ȝw&ydot; heo wolde so gon
ÞIs womman seide swuch da&ydot; was &punctelev; Ich couþe minne mete Iwinne iwinne
Ake nouþe mine hondene me beoth binome &punctelev; þat Ine ma&ydot; sevw&ydot; ne spinne
Mo&rrot;e so&rrot;ewe þane me is on &punctelev; neuere nas ifounde
Alas þat ich nadde me ad&rrot;eint &punctelev; awei þat ilke &slong;tounde
¶Womman seide seint peter Peter þo &punctelev; folliche þov de&slong;t telle
Fo&rrot; þe Man man þat himseolfue aslowe &punctelev; his soule scholde into helle
Sire heo seide wu&slong;te ich þe soþe &punctelev; þat soulene libbe scholde
After þusse liue I nolde bileue &punctelev; þat meseolf aquelle inolde
Þat Ich miȝte one &slong;tounde &punctelev; mine sones iseo
Ine rouȝte sethþe þei ich scholde &punctelev; euereft in helle beo
Fo&rrot; mi louerd and mi[overlined.] ȝongo&rrot;e sone &punctelev; þat
ich bilefte at rome Rome
And wende fo&rrot;th with mine tweie sones &punctelev; ake þo we in þe se come
Þat schip b&rrot;ak and mine leoue sones &punctelev; ne miȝten neuereft beo ifounde
Ake me heo ca&slong;te to londe al quik &punctelev; allas þulke &slong;tounde
Ine mai fo&rrot; feblesse wende aȝein &punctelev; ne Ine habbe no man þat me lede
And not ȝweþer mi louerd and mi ȝongue sone &punctelev; beon quike oþur dede
Clement seide seint peter Peter &punctelev; þat min o desciple nouþe is
Seith þat is fader and is moder &punctelev; þis cas bifeollen[al. bifel] iwis
Þis womman feol adon iswowe &punctelev; þo heo iheo&rrot;de þis
Þo heo aros heo cride ȝeo&rrot;ne &punctelev; and weop fo&rrot; Ioie and blis
And seide sire þat is mi sone &punctelev; tech me ȝware he beo
Ine wilne mi lijf no leng to habbe &punctelev; bote þat ich him enes iseo
Seint peter Peter seide cum fo&rrot;th with me &punctelev; to him ichulle þe lede
Ake ne beo þov nouȝt aknowe to him &punctelev; ero&rrot;e þane ich þe rede
he nam þis wommane bi þe hond &punctelev; and to hire sone hire b&rrot;ouȝte
Þo seint Clement isaiȝ him lede ane womman &punctelev; vuel bi him he þouȝte
And seide nouþe In þine olde liue &punctelev; woltþou with wommane beo
So wroth he was þat vnneþe he wolde &punctelev; toward him biseo
¶Þis guode wijf &slong;tod bi hire sone &punctelev; heo ne miȝte fo&rrot;bere nonmo&rrot;e
heo bicluppte him fa&slong;te and cu&slong;te anon &punctelev; fo&rrot; Io&ydot;e ioye heo weop ful so&rrot;e
hire hondene þat hire weren binome &punctelev; anonriȝt hole hu&ydot; were
Fo&rrot; Io&ydot;e ioye and fo&rrot; grete vertue &punctelev; of þe holie men þere
SEint Clement was wroth with hire &punctelev; fo&rrot; heo biclupte him and cu&slong;te[MS. clupte]
And in grete wrathþe hire pulte awei &punctelev; and to þe grounde up&rrot;iȝt þru&slong;te
Clement seide seint peter Peter þo &punctelev; dar&slong;tþov þine moder pulte
Þov cri hire Merci and lat þe schriue &punctelev; fo&rrot; þine foule gulte
Louerd seide seint clemet Clement [þo] &punctelev; ȝweþur þis mi moder beo
Louerd ihered beo þi miȝte &punctelev; þat ich mo&slong;te þis da&ydot; iseo
To is moder he ful adoun &punctelev; and biclupte hire and cu&slong;te
Welle þe Io&ydot;e ioye þat þare was &punctelev; þo eiþur of oþur wu&slong;te
Þis w&ydot;f seide leoue sone þin o&rrot;e &punctelev; ȝweþur þi fader aliue beo
Certes moder he seide inot &punctelev; Ine wene neuereft him iseo
Twenti ȝer it is ago &punctelev; þat he After after þe iwende
Þat neuereft Ine heo&rrot;de wo&rrot;d of him &punctelev; ne he ne cam ne sende
Þis guode w&ydot;f bigan to weope so&rrot;e &punctelev; ake natheles fo&rrot; blisse
Of hire sone þat heo hadde Ifounde ifounde &punctelev; hire seo&rrot;uwe heo gan to lisse
Euere &slong;toden bi seint peter Peter &punctelev; his oþere desciples tweie
Þat fram s&ydot;mon Symon Magus weren icome to him &punctelev; and ȝeo&rrot;ne biheolden beie
hu&ydot; iheo&rrot;den hou þis guode w&ydot;f tolde &punctelev; to clemente Clemente hire sone þere
hov hire tweie leoue sones &punctelev; in þe se ad&rrot;einte were
Þo hu&ydot; hadden þis tale iheo&rrot;d &punctelev; hu&ydot; weren swiþe glad
Fo&rrot; Io&ydot;e ioye hu&ydot; &slong;toden ase þei hu&ydot; weren &punctelev; witlese oþur[orig.and] amad
louerd hu&ydot; seiden ȝweþer þis beo soth &punctelev; þat we iheo&rrot;ez nouþe telle
oþur us þinchez ase in metingue &punctelev; oþur in manere of spelle
hit is soth seint peter Peter seide &punctelev; oþur me þinchez ȝe beoth wode
hu&ydot; nu&slong;ten ȝweþur to beon &slong;tille oþur speke &punctelev; bote ase g&ydot;die men hu&ydot; &slong;tode
¶Louerd hu&ydot; seiden here is o&rrot;e Moder moder &punctelev; þat ad&rrot;eint was ase we wende
Ihered he beo þat hire hath to liue ib&rrot;ouȝt &punctelev; And þat hire to us sende
And þis is Clement o&rrot;e ȝongue b&rrot;oþur &punctelev; þat longue hath ibeo o&rrot;e fere
Nu&slong;te we neuere er ȝwat he was &punctelev; are þo&rrot;uȝ godes Godes grace nouþe here
Louerd þe Io&ydot;e ioye þat þe[re] was &punctelev; And þat manie Miȝten miȝten iseo
bitwene þe guode w&ydot;f and hire sones &punctelev; þe swete b&rrot;eþren þreo
ÞIs guode w&ydot;f axede hire twe&ydot;e sones &punctelev; hov hu&ydot; to liue come
Dame hu&ydot; seiden ase god God it wolde &punctelev; a bo&rrot;d of þe sch&ydot;pe we nome
And þaron we hienguen and hit bar us fo&rrot;th &punctelev; into þe se wel wide
Marineres us token into heo&rrot;e schipe &punctelev; ase we floten heom biside
Are hu&ydot; us hadden to londe ib&rrot;ouȝt &punctelev; hu&ydot; nolden neuere afine
To Ane ane holie w&ydot;dewe hu&ydot; solden us &punctelev; þat hiet dame Dame
Iu&slong;tine
Þat us lokede nesche Inovȝ &punctelev; as þei we hire sones were
And god God ȝielde it hire of clergie &punctelev; heo liet us sone lere
So þat we beoth nouþe godes Godes desciples &punctelev; and with his Apo&slong;tle here
Ore b&rrot;oþur clement Clement we knoweth nouþe fur&slong;t &punctelev; þat ȝare hath ibeon o&rrot;e fere
And nouþe we beoth here togadere come &punctelev; we mowen iseo godes Godes miȝte
Þat euere wole mannes ȝw&ydot;le ȝelde &punctelev; þat seruez him with riȝte
Ech man wot wel þat þis Iheo&rrot;th iheorth &punctelev; þe&ydot; we ne seggen it ilome
gret Io&ydot;e ioye bitwene heom alle was &punctelev; þo hu&ydot; togadere come
¶þis guode w&ydot;f heom tolde of hire ho&slong;tesse &punctelev; þat Innede innede hire bi n&ydot;ȝte
Þat heo was a guod womman and was bed&rrot;ade &punctelev; ȝif hu&ydot; hire hele miȝten
SEint petre Petre hire let fette &punctelev; and þo&rrot;uȝ o&rrot;e louerdes grace
Made hire hol bifo&rrot;e al þat folk &punctelev; anon in þulke place.
Ase seint petre Petre p&rrot;echede a da&ydot; &punctelev; he seide in his p&rrot;echingue
Þat hoso seruede o&rrot;e louerd wel &punctelev; scholde habbe guod endingue
¶Þo &slong;tod þare op a swiþe old man &punctelev; his lockes weren ful ho&rrot;e
pouere and &slong;toupinde and miseise &punctelev; he bigan to siken so&rrot;e
gret revþe he seide ich habbe of eov &punctelev; þat ȝe bitra&ydot;ez men so
Ech man bifallez ase his ȝwate is &punctelev; ȝwatso he euere do
¶Fo&rrot; þei a man sw&ydot;ncke and crie on god God &punctelev; and bidde ȝeo&rrot;ne is bede
him schal bifalle guod oþur vuel &punctelev; ase it is him iqueþe
Þei mani man beo wis and euere sw&ydot;nke &punctelev; he ne ma&ydot; neuere bate
And þei manie don vuele and euere folie &punctelev; ȝeot he hath guod ȝwate
¶Seint petre Petre hiet þe þreo b&rrot;eþren &punctelev; þat is desciples were
Despu&ydot;ti aȝein þis olde man &punctelev; of þat he tolde þere
hu&ydot; &slong;toden and heo&rrot;e [r]esones[orig. o&rrot;esones] seiden &punctelev; þat ech man scholde afongue
After þat he wurche wolde &punctelev; And elles it were with wrongue
Fo&rrot; hoso nath no guod ne swinke nele &punctelev; ne of po&rrot;ueance beo
Ȝwatsoeuere man beo Iqueþe iqueþe Iqueþe &punctelev; he ne ma&ydot; it neuere fleo[r. iþeo]
And [ho]so is w&ydot;s to winne guod &punctelev; and wel it witie can
Ȝwatsoeuere is ȝwate beo &punctelev; he wo&rrot;th riche man
Fo&rrot; o&rrot;e louerd wole here and ellesȝware &punctelev; ȝelden ane mannes seruise
After þat he himseolf wurche wole &punctelev; ake aftur ȝwate in none wise
GRet clerk was þis olde Man man &punctelev; he desputede wel fa&slong;te
Aȝein þe þreo b&rrot;eþren with gret reson &punctelev; þat pla&ydot;t wel longue la&slong;te
Seint Clement was grette&slong;t clerk &punctelev; þarefo&rrot;e atþenende
Mai&slong;ter he was þo&rrot;uȝ grace &punctelev; þat o&rrot;e louerd him wolde sende
Atþe la&slong;te þis olde Man man &punctelev; bigan to sike and grone
And seid[e] wel icholde ileue &punctelev; ower resones echone
Ȝif I ne hadde to muche ifondet &punctelev; of þinge þat geth bi ȝwate
Alas þulke so&rrot;uful t&ydot;me &punctelev; fo&rrot; mi confo&rrot;t cometh to late
Riche man ich was ellesȝware &punctelev; þei ich beo nouþe a wrechche here
Ich hadde þreo ȝoungue child&rrot;en &punctelev; and a guod wif þat was mi fere
Mine tweie sones heo ladde awei &punctelev; þo we heom hadden al biswonke
Ine heo&rrot;de neuereft wo&rrot;d of heom &punctelev; Ich wot hu&ydot; beoth ad&rrot;onke
Alle m&ydot;ne freond and al mi guod &punctelev; Ich bilefte me bih&ydot;nde
And habbe here iwalke in onkovþe londe &punctelev; ȝif ich heom miȝte if&ydot;nde
Mi ȝonge&slong;te child ich bilefte athom &punctelev; Ich wene þat he beo ded
Wo&rrot;se ȝwate nadde neuere man &punctelev; Inot ȝwat is mi red
And ich am[overlined.]þare no man me ne knoweth &punctelev; mid miseise ouercome
honguer and chele hath m&ydot;ne leomes &punctelev; and elde me binome
Seggez ovsulf ȝif ȝe euere Iheo&rrot;den &punctelev; Ani so deolful cas
ho is þat ne ma&ydot; ileue &punctelev; þat luþur ȝwate it nas
¶Þo þis þreo b&rrot;eþren ho&rrot;e fader iknewen &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ þat he hadde ised
Sturten hu&ydot; wolden and cussen him &punctelev; ake seint petre Petre heom fo&rrot;bed
And seide ȝif ich b&rrot;ingue bifo&rrot;e þe ihole &punctelev; þine child&rrot;en and þi wijf
Woltþov fo&rrot;hote þine misbileue &punctelev; and amendi þi lijf
And ileue
þing þat þat þing comez ase god God wole &punctelev; and noþing after ȝwate
Ȝe sire seide þis olde man &punctelev; Ake þat wo&rrot;th so wel late
Also ase it neuere ne wo&rrot;th &punctelev; þat ich iseo heom alle
And so ne wo&rrot;th hit neuere þat muche þing &punctelev; nele bi ȝwate falle
¶Lo seide seint petre Petre þo &punctelev; þis beoth þine sones þreo
Þat fo&rrot;to b&rrot;ingue þe in godes Godes lawe &punctelev; plaidiez aȝein þe
Þo þis olde Man man iheo&rrot;de þis &punctelev; his limes him bere nolde
hu&ydot; nescheden ase doth wex aȝein þe fu&ydot;re &punctelev; And ful adon on þe molde
he lai al cold withoute b&rrot;eþe &punctelev; ase þei he no l&ydot;f nadde
his [sones] him clupten a[n]d cu&slong;ten him &punctelev; so&rrot;e hu&ydot; weopen and gradde
hu&ydot; beren him aboute and bleowen on him &punctelev; ȝif hu&ydot; him miȝten in &slong;tat b&rrot;ingue
Longue it was are heo miȝten &punctelev; iseo of liue &punctelev; Ani riȝt tokningue
Þo is &slong;tat him was icome &punctelev; he axede anonriȝt þere
hov hu&ydot; weren aliue fo&rrot;th ib&rrot;ouȝt &punctelev; so freondlese ase hu&ydot; were
Euerech tolde in his wise &punctelev; o&rrot;e swete louerdes miȝte
Þat he on heom ischewed hadde &punctelev; hoso onder&slong;tode þe riȝte
Ase hu&ydot; tolden of heo&rrot;e lijf &punctelev; euerech in his side
Þis guode wif o&rrot;n ase heo were wilde &punctelev; and swiþe loude heo cride
Ȝware is mi louerd? ȝware is mi spouse? &punctelev; schewez him me anon
hu&ydot; biclupten heom and fullen adoun &punctelev; a fote ne miȝten hu&ydot; gon
Mo&rrot;e Io&ydot;e ioye ne miȝte beo iseiȝe &punctelev; bi none mannes liue
Þane was þo hu&ydot; togadere comen &punctelev; among heom alle fiue
here we mouwen alle iseo &punctelev; o&rrot;e swete louerdes miȝte
Þat euere atþenende he wole ȝelde &punctelev; þe manne þat him seruez with riȝte
HIt biful þat þe Aumperour &punctelev; oueral sende is sonde
S&ydot;mon Magus þe luþere man &punctelev; to sechen him into al þe londe
Fo&rrot;to sleen him hoso him miȝte Ifinde &punctelev; al fo&rrot; his luþerhede
And þo s&ydot;mon Symon Magus iheo&rrot;de þarof &punctelev; he was in grete d&rrot;ede
On feolonie he þouȝte fo&rrot; wrathþe &punctelev; of þe b&rrot;eþren tweie
Fau&slong;t and Fau&slong;tin þat weren with him &punctelev; and departed fram him beiȝe
bi ho&rrot;e fader he cam a da&ydot; &punctelev; ase þe deuel him gan lere
And ca&slong;te on him is owene fourme &punctelev; ase þei it himsulf were
Þo&rrot;uȝ is foul enchauntement &punctelev; hoso þene olde manne iseiȝe
wenden þat s&ydot;mon Symon magus it were &punctelev; þare was þe deuel to sleiȝe
Fo&rrot; þe Io&ydot;e ioye þat his sones hadden &punctelev; of him þare in one &slong;tounde
And fo&rrot; he scholde beon fo&rrot; him aslawe &punctelev; ȝif he miȝte beon ifounde
Fo&rrot; euere þe deuel and alle his &punctelev; of feolonie doth þenche
Ake atþe la&slong;te hu&ydot; wo&rrot;þeth bitraid &punctelev; with heo&rrot;e feolle wrenche
¶S&ydot;mon Magus wende awei[orig. aȝen] &punctelev; þo al þis idon was
Þis guode [man] ȝeode fo&rrot;th to is child&rrot;en &punctelev; he nu&slong;te nouȝt of þat cas
he cam and wolde gret Io&ydot;e ioye make &punctelev; with heom and with is wiue
hu&ydot; spatten on him euerechone &punctelev; and heten him awei wel bliue
Fo&rrot; he was þe deueles l&ydot;me &punctelev; hu&ydot; nolden nouȝt with him dele
Ake bote he þe sonere fram heom ȝeode &punctelev; him to wroþer hele
Alas seide þis olde Man man &punctelev; Mine mine leoue[overlined.] child&rrot;en þreo
Ȝwi wolle ȝe ouwer fader þus pulte and bete? &punctelev; nelle ȝe me nonmo&rrot;e iseo
Na&ydot; seiden þis b&rrot;eþren þreo &punctelev; þov nart o&rrot;e fader nouȝt
Þov art s&ydot;mon Symon Magus
godes Godes tricho&rrot; &punctelev; to deþe þov wo&rrot;&slong;t ib&rrot;ouȝt
Ȝif þe Aumpero&rrot;es [men] þe mouwen finde &punctelev; þat wide þe habbez isouȝt
Þov wo&rrot;&slong;t tod&rrot;awe ase þe deueles lime &punctelev; fo&rrot; falshede þat þou ha&slong;t iwrouȝt
¶Louerd merci seide þis olde man &punctelev; ȝwodere ma&ydot; ich nouþe iwende
Nouþe mi wijf ne mine sones me nellez iknowe &punctelev; o dai to þenende
Me&slong;t wrechche ich am of alle men &punctelev; nouþe I ne habbe freond non
bote heom and hu&ydot; me wollez asle &punctelev; ȝwodere ma&ydot; ich nouþe gon
¶S&ydot;mon Magus þareatfo&rrot;e &punctelev; in Auntioche ase[al. om.] he wende
And seint petre Petre bifo&rrot;e al þat folk &punctelev; with lesingues foule he schende
he seide þat he manquellare was &punctelev; and wichche and eke fo&rrot;swo&rrot;e
Þat folk awa&ydot;tede him fo&rrot;to sle &punctelev; In Aunt&ydot;oche þarefo&rrot;e
¶Seint petre Petre þis onderȝat &punctelev; he wolde beon awreke he þouȝte
he cam to þis seli oldeman &punctelev; þat him wel longue souȝte
beo &slong;tille he seide and do Aftur aftur me &punctelev; and soffre a lu&ydot;tel þrowe
And Ichulle makien þat þi wijf &punctelev; and þine sones &punctelev; þe schullen sone iknowe
Þov schalt gon Into into
Auntioche &punctelev; þare s&ydot;mon Symon Magus was
Ase he me desclaund&rrot;et hath &punctelev; and segge of þis ilke cas
In his name ase ech man weneth &punctelev; þat þov he himsulue beo
And segge þat hit lesingue is &punctelev; þat þov seide&slong;t opon me
And line also þine owene Mouth mouth &punctelev; as þei it beo in his name
And þat hit was al les þat þov seide&slong;t &punctelev; to b&rrot;ingue me in luþer fame
And þat þov art þarof repentaunt &punctelev; so&rrot;i and swiþe wel Ischriue
Of þe lesingue þat þov bi me seide&slong;t &punctelev; and bide heom it þe fo&rrot;ȝ&ydot;ue
ÞIs olde Man man ȝeode him fo&rrot;th &punctelev; Into into
Auntioche anon
And ȝede aboute to Man man i a &slong;tude &punctelev; þare s&ydot;mon Symon hadde Igon igon
Guode Men men he seide ȝif ich habbe itold &punctelev; bi seint
petre Petre eniþing
bote guod and gret trewenesse &punctelev; fo&rrot;soþe it is lesing
here bifo&rrot;en eov euerechone &punctelev; ich lixni minne owene Mouth
Fo&rrot; he is treowe and &slong;tudefa&slong;t &punctelev; and is guodnesse is wide couth
Fo&rrot;to saui al þat lond &punctelev; o&rrot;e louerd him hath isent
bilieueth and wurcheth aftur him &punctelev; oþur ȝe beoth alle Ischent
Fo&rrot; ȝe eovseolf and Al al eower guod &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ o&rrot;e louerdes wreche
hit schal fo&rrot;fare bote ȝe don &punctelev; ase he eov wole lere ant teche
Ȝif ich euereeft mo&rrot;e am so &punctelev; in þe deoueles weo&rrot;ke Ib&rrot;ouȝt ibrouȝt
Þat Ich aniþing oþur bi him segge &punctelev; ne leuez me þarof nouȝt
Ake doth me[overlined.] schame and betez me &punctelev; ant b&rrot;inguez me of dawe
Ase men schullen a &slong;trong liare &punctelev; and man of false lawe
¶ ÞareAfturward Þareafturward he cam to seint petre Petre &punctelev; and he is leomen riȝte
And b&rrot;ouȝte him aȝein to is owene fourme &punctelev; al þo&rrot;uȝ godes Godes miȝte
Þo was þere gret Io&ydot;e ioye bitweone [is sones][om.] &punctelev; and him and eke is wiue
þo hu&ydot; weren in riȝte fourme &punctelev; togadere alle fiue
Euere is &slong;trengo&rrot;e o&rrot;e swete louerd &punctelev; þane þe deuel atþende
And s&ydot;mon Symon Magusis tricherie &punctelev; opon himsulf it gan iwiende
Al[al. fo&rrot;] Auntioche wel gret loue &punctelev; opon seint petre Petre ca&slong;te
And so&rrot;e heom longuede after him &punctelev; and leten him seche fa&slong;te
¶Seint Petre cam to Auntioche &punctelev; ase he hadde er Ilome
Men and wommen of þe lond &punctelev; wel glade aboute him come
And Anoureden anoureden him su&ydot;þe muche &punctelev; ase ane p&rrot;ince of godes Godes lawe
And Ase ase heo&rrot;e mai&slong;ter and heo&rrot;e louerd &punctelev; hu&ydot; weren of him wel fawe
In riche cha&ydot;re hu&ydot; setten him &punctelev; and knevlede him bifo&rrot;e
And beden wel ȝeo&rrot;ne him wardi heom &punctelev; and techen þat heo&rrot;e soulene neren fo&rrot;lo&rrot;e
¶Þis was aseint petres Petres da&ydot; &punctelev; þat comez in feuerer
Þat fo&rrot; þe honour of þulke dede &punctelev; men helewiez feo&rrot; and ner
Þo þis dede was al Idon idon &punctelev; and seint petre Petre þannes iwend
S&ydot;mon Magus h&ydot;ede þudere &punctelev; and heold him foule Ischend ischend
bifo&rrot;e al þis folk he cam &punctelev; Muche muche wonder me þinchez he sede
Þat ich ouwer soulebote herebifo&rrot;e &punctelev; and to eouwer guod gan eov rede
Þat ȝe ne flouwen petre Petre þane trichour &punctelev; þat he among eov ne come
And nouȝt one ne Ano&rrot;eden ano&rrot;eden him &punctelev; ake wit grete nobleie him nome
And an heiȝ in chaire In chaire in chaire setten him &punctelev; ase he eouwer cri&slong;t Crist were
Fleoth fram him ȝif ȝe wollez isauede beon &punctelev; and doth ase ich eov lere
¶Þo al þat folk iheo&rrot;de þis &punctelev; fo&rrot; wrathþe heo weren neiȝ wode
False trichour hu&ydot; seiden þis oþur da&ydot; &punctelev; bifo&rrot;e us here þov &slong;tode
And seide&slong;t þat he was treowe and guod &punctelev; and þat we after him do scholde
And sei&slong;t nouþe þat he is luþer and fals &punctelev; þi ȝwile wo&rrot;th sone iȝolde
hu&ydot; &slong;turten fo&rrot;th and beoten þis foule þeof &punctelev; þat he was neiȝ aslawe
Nadde he þe revlocur icried on heom &punctelev; he&ydot;[r. hu&ydot;] wolden him habbe tod&rrot;awe
Ase he miȝte he crep awei &punctelev; with man&ydot; a luþur &slong;trok
Þare he himseolf ase euerech sw&ydot;ke doth &punctelev; himseolf he biswok
Seint petre Petre ȝeode to rome Rome &punctelev; with his desciple þreo
he wu&slong;te þat is t&ydot;me was neiȝ &punctelev; þat he Imartred imartred scholde beo
Seint Clement al bi is da&ydot;e &punctelev; he made him pope at rome Rome
Þat he guode ȝeme after him &punctelev; to holie churche nome
¶Þo seint petre Petre
Imartred imartred was &punctelev; seint clement Clement him bisouȝte[al. biþouȝte vv. 4014 are co&rrot;rupted.]
Ȝif he bilefte pope fo&rrot;th &punctelev; ase þat folk him bisouȝte
Þat no pope ne miȝte aftur him &punctelev; Ane ane oþurne pope make
Ȝwam so hu&ydot; wolden þo&rrot;uȝ heo&rrot;e wille &punctelev; oþur fo&rrot;[on the margin.] eni mede take
Þat he him bad fo&rrot; godes Godes loue &punctelev; þat no pope bi is da&ydot;e
Non oþur pope ne scholde maken so &punctelev; holie churche to bitra&ydot;e;[vv. 4034 added.]
Fo&rrot; a wardein of holie churche &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ is godnesse man schal take
Þat[al. om.; r. and?] nouȝt ase it were bi heritage &punctelev; þat o freond þat oþur make
he tok up is dignete &punctelev; fo&rrot; al þat man him bad
And seint l&ydot;n þat was a guod man &punctelev; was pope in his &slong;tude Imad imad
After seint l&ydot;nes Lynes da&ydot;e &punctelev; alle þe men wolde
Seint clemente Clemente habbe pope Imad &punctelev; ake fo&rrot; noþing ȝeot he nolde
Se[int][MS. Se] Clete hu&ydot; maden pope þo &punctelev; ake after is daiȝe anon
Þat folk heold seint clement Clement fa&slong;te &punctelev; hu&ydot; nolden him nouȝt fo&rrot;gon
hAlflingue with &slong;trencþe hu&ydot; maden him pope &punctelev; and þo hit cam þarto
he fondede to pa&ydot;e euerech Man man &punctelev; riche and pouere also
he honourede mo&rrot;e þe pouere Men men &punctelev; þane he dude þe riche
to helpe mo&rrot;e is soule þane is bodi &punctelev; fo&rrot; hu&ydot; ne beot nouȝt Iliche
Sis&ydot;me þe Iu&slong;tise iustise of þe lond &punctelev; hadde a swiþe guod wijf
Þat þo&rrot;uȝ se seint
clemet Clement
Icri&slong;tned icristned was &punctelev; fo&rrot;to amendi hire lijf
Ȝwane heo miȝte fram hire louerd [heo &slong;tole] &punctelev; al withoute fiere
A da&ydot; ase[on the margin.] heo wolde to churche gon &punctelev; he siwede hire wel swiþe.[2 vv. om.]
Sone so heo to churche cam &punctelev; and hire hovsebonde onderȝat[MS. it onderȝat]
Ad&rrot;ad heo was and hudde hire &punctelev; in one [derne] &slong;tude heo sat
Þo seint clement Clement seide is o&rrot;esun &punctelev; and is clerkes amen seide
Þe Iu&slong;tise iustise iwerth boþe def and blind &punctelev; wel loude he gan to grede
Ȝware beo ȝe nouþe mine men? &punctelev; ovt ȝe moten me lede
Fo&rrot; Ine mai miseolf Iseo ne heo&rrot;e &punctelev; ȝwat mai ich torede
cometh fo&rrot;th to me euerechone &punctelev; and out heonnes ȝe me leden[vv. 4267 al. om.]
his Men men &slong;turten fo&rrot;th And and nomen him op &punctelev; hu&ydot; swatten alle fo&rrot; d&rrot;ede
hu&ydot; beren him alaboute þe churche &punctelev; hu&ydot; ne miȝten þe do&rrot;e finde
Ȝwane hu&ydot; wenden atþe do&rrot;e to beo &punctelev; þanne weren hu&ydot; feo&rrot; bihinde
So&rrot;e was þis guode wijf ad&rrot;ad &punctelev; þo heo isaiȝ heom so fare
heo Axede axede ȝwat hire louerd were &punctelev; fo&rrot; no leng ne miȝte heo spare
hu&ydot; seiden fo&rrot; he wolde[orig. hu&ydot; wolden]
Iseon iseon and Iheo&rrot;e iheore &punctelev; oþur þane to him bicome
bicome he is blijnd and def &punctelev; here in þe churche of Rome
Þis guode wijf bad o&rrot;e louerd ȝeo&rrot;ne &punctelev; þat hu&ydot; mo&slong;ten þannes ovt wende
Þo founden þis men þe do&rrot;e anon &punctelev; and wenden out atþenende
Þis guode wijf bad Clement ȝeo&rrot;ne &punctelev; to hire louerd come
And amendi him þo&rrot;uȝ godes Godes grace &punctelev; of is limes þat him weren binome
¶Seint clement Clement and þis guode wijf to þis luþere man gonne teo
hu&ydot; founden him loki swiþe b&rrot;ode &punctelev; and noþing ne miȝte iseo.[vv. 43940 al. om.]
Seint clement Clement bad o&rrot;e louerd fo&rrot; him &punctelev; and þo he idon hadde
his heo&rrot;ingue and is siȝt him cam aȝein &punctelev; ake neuere þonk he ne hadde
Fo&rrot; anon so he isaiȝ seint clement Clement &slong;tonde &punctelev; bi is wiue he wende
And seide þat he hadde bi hire ileie &punctelev; and þarefo&rrot;e he him ablende
Þis guode wijf ȝeode into hire p&rrot;euetez &punctelev; and Iesu cri&slong;t Crist [bad] wel fa&slong;te
Þat hire louerd þo&rrot;uȝ is grace &punctelev; into betere bileue him ca&slong;te
SEint petre Petre fram heouene &punctelev; to hire aliȝte adoun
And s[e]ide hire louerd scholde isaued beo &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ hire o&rrot;esun
Fo&rrot; seint powel Powel seide seide
þat a luþer man &punctelev; scholde isaued beo
Þo&rrot;uȝ guodnesse of a godwomman &punctelev; And so it wo&rrot;th bi him and þe
Þis guode w&ydot;f eode to hire louerd &punctelev; and p&rrot;echede him of cri&slong;tinedom
So þat he þo&rrot;uȝ godes Godes grace &punctelev; into guode bileue he com
he liet him cri&slong;tni sone anon &punctelev; and al is ma&ydot;[n]e þere
Þre hond&rrot;et men and tweolue &punctelev; with him icri&slong;tnede were
¶ TraIan Traian þe luþere Amperour &punctelev; herof he heo&rrot;de speke
he swo&rrot; he wolde fo&rrot; his Iu&slong;tise iustise &punctelev; of seint clement Clement beo awreke
he comaundede Mamert&ydot;n &punctelev; þat was an oþur Iu&slong;tise iustise
Þat he scholde maken clement Clement þe pope &punctelev; to don heom sacrefise
Oþur maken him out of londe fleme &punctelev; þat he ne lete it nouȝt
La&slong;te heo&rrot;e lawe and heo&rrot;e godes weren &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ him to grounde ib&rrot;ouȝt
¶Þis Iu&slong;tise iustise wende þo wiþ[MS. þouȝ] gret power &punctelev; And seint clement Clement he nom[orig. nam]
And fo&rrot; he nolde don heo&rrot;e godes sacrefise &punctelev; he ȝaf him an oþur dom
Þat he scholde beon out of londe id&rrot;iue &punctelev; into wildernesse
Ase a þeof he was iharlet fo&rrot;th &punctelev; in wel f&ydot;l de&slong;tresse
Þo he into wildernesse cam &punctelev; to þousende he fond þere
Of cri&slong;tine Men men þat hadden þer &punctelev; longue iwoned fo&rrot; fere
La&slong;te þe Aumperoures men &punctelev; In in to&rrot;ment heom hadden ib&rrot;ouȝt
And hu&ydot; fo&rrot; d&rrot;ede of &slong;trongue deþe &punctelev; weren in feble þouȝt
Fo&rrot; manie men bi þulke daie &punctelev; fo&rrot; d&rrot;ede of þulke þingue
Ase be&slong;tes hu&ydot; leoueden in wildernesse &punctelev; þo cri&slong;tinedom bigan fur&slong;t sp&rrot;ingue
Wel glade weren þis guode men &punctelev; þo hu&ydot; seint clement Clement iseiȝe
heo ȝeoden aȝein him and þonkeden god God &punctelev; weopinde with heo&rrot;e eie
hu&ydot; maden seint clement Clement heo&rrot;e Mai&slong;ter maister þere &punctelev; pope ase he was
Þare nas non þat in &slong;tudefa&slong;t lijf &punctelev; fo&rrot; him amendet ne was
Water hu&ydot; nadden neiȝ heom non &punctelev; bi six Mile mile wei wel longue
Al heo&rrot;e d&rrot;inke hu&ydot; fetten þare &punctelev; in weiȝe swiþe &slong;tronge
Seint clement Clement [bad] o&rrot;e louerd cri&slong;t Crist &punctelev; ȝif hit is wille were
Þat he holpe is trewe couent &punctelev; and sende heom watur þere
he isaiȝ a lomb &slong;tonde and marki &punctelev; with is riȝt fot ane &slong;tude
he isaiȝ þat hit o&rrot;e louerd was &punctelev; to don þat he hadde ibede
¶Seint clement Clement ȝeode and smot in þulke &slong;tude &punctelev; as þat lomb markede er
Þare sp&rrot;ong a welle fair and guod &punctelev; wel gret Io&ydot;e ioye was þer
Þis Miracle was widen icud &punctelev; fif hond&rrot;et men þarefo&rrot;e
bicomen cri&slong;tine and blesseden þe time &punctelev; þat seint clement Clement was ibo&rrot;e
Þo ȝede he fo&rrot;þere among þe men &punctelev; and so fair Miracle wrouȝte
Swiþe muche folk to guode bileue &punctelev; and to Iesu cri&slong;t Crist he b&rrot;ouȝte
F&ydot;f hond&rrot;ed of Maumates &punctelev; to grounde he b&rrot;ouȝte þere
And sixti churche and fiftene &punctelev; in heo&rrot;e &slong;tudes he liet arere
So þat traIan þe Aumperour &punctelev; herof heo&rrot;de telle
Ane du&ydot;k of gret power he sende þudere &punctelev; þane guode man fo&rrot;to quelle
Þis du&ydot;k him nam and liet to[overlined.] him binde &punctelev; grete[orig. and gr.] &slong;tones wel fa&slong;te
And ladden him feo&rrot; into þe deope se &punctelev; and riȝt amidde him ca&slong;te
Welle muche was þe deol &punctelev; þat is desciples fo&rrot; him made
Into þe se hu&ydot; o&rrot;nen to sechen him &punctelev; ase feo&rrot; ase hu&ydot; do&rrot;&slong;ten wade
Þo hu&ydot; ne miȝten neiȝ him come &punctelev; o&rrot;e louerd wel ȝeo&rrot;ne hu&ydot; beade[r. bade]
to ȝiuen heom a siȝt of seint clement Clement &punctelev; þe mo&rrot;e to beon glade
Ase hu&ydot; seten opon þe .se &punctelev; and crieden on him wel fa&slong;te and ȝeo&rrot;ne
Þe .se. wel swiftliche hire withd&rrot;avȝ[al. wiþd&rrot;ouȝ] &punctelev; and with gret e&ydot;r In in gan eo&rrot;ne
So þat withinne þe deope .se &punctelev; þreo grete Milene and mo&rrot;e
A swiþe fair wei and d&rrot;u&ydot;e þare was &punctelev; ihere[d] beo godes Godes o&rrot;e
Þis guode men bi þis faire wei &punctelev; Into þe .se. gonne to wende
Ane churche hui founden of Marb&rrot;e imaud &punctelev; riȝt atþe weies ende
WithInne þe churche hu&ydot; founden ane cofre &punctelev; of seluer and of golde
And þarinne seint clementes Clementes bodi &punctelev; ase o&rrot;e louer[d] it wolde
Welle louerd muche was þe Io&ydot;e ioye &punctelev; þat þis guode Men men inne were
Fo&rrot; þe faire Miracle miracle of seint clement Clement &punctelev; þat hu&ydot; founden þere
hu&ydot; beden heo&rrot;e beden ȝwatso hu&ydot; wolden &punctelev; and wenden aȝen atþenende
euere o&rrot;n þe se after heom wel fa&slong;te &punctelev; at heo&rrot;e helene bihinde
Fo&rrot;to heo cam to hire riȝte &slong;tude &punctelev; and þare heo gan at&slong;tonde
Þis guode men serueden god God þe bet &punctelev; and þonke[den] ȝeo&rrot;ne is sonde
Longue þeraftur it bifeol &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ o&rrot;e louerdes he&slong;te
fram ȝer to ȝere seue dawes &punctelev; at seint clementes Clementes fe&slong;tes
þat þe se ire wolde so withd&rrot;awe &punctelev; and makie ane wei wel d&rrot;u&ydot;e
To þe holie chapele of seint clement Clement &punctelev; þat no watur ne scholde man anu&ydot;e
Þat ech Man man alle þe seuen dawes &punctelev; al d&rrot;u&ydot;e wende and clene
Fo&rrot;to honouri þat holie bodi &punctelev; ase it bifeol eche ȝere ene
And Anonriȝt anonriȝt þe se wende aȝein &punctelev; with watur and with sl&ydot;me
After þe eiȝte dawes and heold him so &punctelev; fo&rrot;to an oþur ȝer þat t&ydot;me
Awommon cam cam
þudere at one t&ydot;me &punctelev; and a child þat was hire sone
Fo&rrot;to Anovri þat swete bodi &punctelev; as it was mannes wone
hit feol at[MS. þat] þe endingue &punctelev; of þe seueþe daiȝe
þat þe se cam eo&rrot;ne & rotte ȝeo&rrot;ne &punctelev; ase þat child aslepe la&ydot;e
Þat folk þat þare was bileued &punctelev; bigonne ateo&rrot;ne fa&slong;te
Þis womman louede hire l&ydot;f also &punctelev; þat heo nas nouȝt þe la&slong;te
Þo heo was to londe icome &punctelev; and hire sone[overlined.] mid hire nadde
Muche was þe deol þat heo made &punctelev; loude heo weop and gradde
gredinde heo o&rrot;n and longue souȝte &punctelev; aboute bi þe seside
Ȝif þe .se. him hadde up ica&slong;t &punctelev; heo souȝte aboute wel wide
Þo heo ne miȝte him nouȝwere ifinde &punctelev; weopinde hom heo wende
And bad seint clement Clement of hire childe &punctelev; þat he sum gladnesse hire sende
heo bilefte al þe ȝer &punctelev; in gret so&rrot; and in care
Anoþur ȝer at seint clementes Clementes tid &punctelev; þuderward heo wolde fare
To þe chapele ȝeo&rrot;ne heo o&rrot;n &punctelev; þo þe se was In iweved[orig. iwend]
hIre[MS. Ire; h added.] sone heo fond in þulke &slong;tude &punctelev; þare heo hine hadde bileued
Sone þis womman nam him up &punctelev; and wende þat he[MS. heo] ded were
Þat child ase þei it woke of slepe &punctelev; Axede axede ȝwat heo wolde þere
Þis womman fo&rrot; Ioie gradde loude &punctelev; þat folk aboute hire wende
And þonkeden god God with grete Io&ydot;e ioye &punctelev; þat swuche miracle him sende
hu&ydot; axeden hov he hadde so longue ileued &punctelev; And ȝif he were ouȝt id&rrot;eiȝt
hit nis novȝt longue þat child seide &punctelev; ake to sone ȝe me me
habbez aweiȝt
Softe and swote i habbe[MS. ȝe habbez] islepe &punctelev; onneþe me þinchez o n&ydot;ȝt
Mo&slong;te ich lengo&rrot;e habbe ileiȝe &punctelev; me hadde ibeo wel idiȝt
With gret Io&ydot;e ioye hu&ydot; ladden þis child hom &punctelev; þis miracle was couth wel wide
Mani fair Miracle miracle seint
clement Clement dude &punctelev; bi þe sees sides
¶þe se withd&rrot;ovȝ hire wel mani a ȝer &punctelev; to maken men d&rrot;u&ydot;e iwende
And þulke miracle fo&rrot; mannes [sunne] &punctelev; bilefde sethþe atþen ende
Þo Men men founden þis holie ȝwuchche &punctelev; In in a fair place &slong;tonde
with þis holie bodi aboue þe se &punctelev; al on d&rrot;u&ydot;e londe
Muche folk with fair p&rrot;ocession &punctelev; þis holie bodi nome
And ladden it fo&rrot;th with gret honour &punctelev; to þe churche of rome Rome
Þare is nouþe seint clementes Clementes churche &punctelev; Imad with quo&ydot;nte g&ydot;nne
god ȝiue us part of þulke Io&ydot;ȝe ioyȝe &punctelev; þat seint clement Clement is inne
